verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Saul was returned from following the Philistines, that it was told him, saying, Behold, David is in the wilderness of Engedi.
verses.web: When Saul had returned from following the Philistines, he was told, “Behold, David is in the wilderness of En Gedi.”
verses.ct: After Saul returned from chasing the Philistines, someone told him, "David is hiding in the wilderness of Engedi."

verses.kjv: Then Saul took three thousand chosen men out of all Israel, and went to seek David and his men upon the rocks of the wild goats.
verses.web: Then Saul took three thousand chosen men out of all Israel, and went to seek David and his men on the rocks of the wild goats.
verses.ct: So Saul handpicked 3,000 of Israel's best soldiers and went searching for David and his men among the rocky cliffs where wild goats roam.

verses.kjv: And he came to the sheepcotes by the way, where was a cave; and Saul went in to cover his feet: and David and his men remained in the sides of the cave.
verses.web: He came to the sheep pens by the way, where there was a cave; and Saul went in to relieve himself. Now David and his men were staying in the innermost parts of the cave.
verses.ct: Along the way, he came to some sheep pens near a cave. Saul went inside to relieve himself — not knowing that David and his men were hiding deep in the back of that very cave.

verses.kjv: And the men of David said unto him, Behold the day of which the LORD said unto thee, Behold, I will deliver thine enemy into thine hand, that thou mayest do to him as it shall seem good unto thee. Then David arose, and cut off the skirt of Saul’s robe privily.
verses.web: David’s men said to him, “Behold, the day of which LORD said to you, ‘Behold, I will deliver your enemy into your hand, and you shall do to him as it shall seem good to you.’ ” Then David arose, and cut off the skirt of Saul’s robe secretly.
verses.ct: David's men whispered to him, "This is the day the LORD was talking about when he said, 'I will hand your enemy over to you, and you can do whatever you want with him.'" David crept forward and secretly cut off a corner of Saul's robe.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass afterward, that David’s heart smote him, because he had cut off Saul’s skirt.
verses.web: Afterward, David’s heart struck him, because he had cut off Saul’s skirt.
verses.ct: But immediately afterward, David's conscience hit him hard for what he had done — even just cutting Saul's robe.

verses.kjv: And he said unto his men, The LORD forbid that I should do this thing unto my master, the LORD’s anointed, to stretch forth mine hand against him, seeing he is the anointed of the LORD.
verses.web: He said to his men, “LORD forbid that I should do this thing to my lord, LORD’s anointed, to stretch out my hand against him, since he is LORD’s anointed.”
verses.ct: He told his men, "The LORD forbid that I would ever do such a thing to my master. He is the LORD's anointed king. I will not raise my hand against him."

verses.kjv: So David stayed his servants with these words, and suffered them not to rise against Saul. But Saul rose up out of the cave, and went on his way.
verses.web: So David checked his men with these words, and didn’t allow them to rise against Saul. Saul rose up out of the cave, and went on his way.
verses.ct: With those words, David held his men back and wouldn't let them attack Saul. Meanwhile, Saul got up and walked out of the cave, continuing on his way.

verses.kjv: David also arose afterward, and went out of the cave, and cried after Saul, saying, My lord the king. And when Saul looked behind him, David stooped with his face to the earth, and bowed himself.
verses.web: David also arose afterward, and went out of the cave, and cried after Saul, saying, “My lord the king!” When Saul looked behind him, David bowed with his face to the earth, and showed respect.
verses.ct: Then David came out of the cave after him and called out, "My lord the king!" When Saul turned around, David bowed down with his face to the ground.

verses.kjv: And David said to Saul, Wherefore hearest thou men’s words, saying, Behold, David seeketh thy hurt?
verses.web: David said to Saul, “Why do you listen to men’s words, saying, ‘Behold, David seeks to harm you?’
verses.ct: David said to Saul, "Why do you listen to people who tell you, 'David is trying to harm you'?

verses.kjv: Behold, this day thine eyes have seen how that the LORD had delivered thee to day into mine hand in the cave: and some bade me kill thee: but mine eye spared thee; and I said, I will not put forth mine hand against my lord; for he is the LORD’s anointed.
verses.web: Behold, today your eyes have seen how LORD had delivered you today into my hand in the cave. Some urged me to kill you; but I spared you; and I said, I will not stretch out my hand against my lord; for he is LORD’s anointed.
verses.ct: Look — today you've seen with your own eyes that the LORD put you in my power back in that cave. Some of my men urged me to kill you, but I refused. I said, 'I won't raise my hand against my master, because he is the LORD's anointed.'

verses.kjv: Moreover, my father, see, yea, see the skirt of thy robe in my hand: for in that I cut off the skirt of thy robe, and killed thee not, know thou and see that there is neither evil nor transgression in mine hand, and I have not sinned against thee; yet thou huntest my soul to take it.
verses.web: Moreover, my father, behold, yes, see the skirt of your robe in my hand; for in that I cut off the skirt of your robe, and didn’t kill you, know and see that there is neither evil nor disobedience in my hand, and I have not sinned against you, though you hunt for my life to take it.
verses.ct: Look, my father — see this piece of your robe in my hand! I cut off the corner of your robe but didn't kill you. Doesn't that prove there is no evil or rebellion in me? I haven't sinned against you, yet you hunt me down to take my life.

verses.kjv: The LORD judge between me and thee, and the LORD avenge me of thee: but mine hand shall not be upon thee.
verses.web: May LORD judge between me and you, and may LORD avenge me of you; but my hand will not be on you.
verses.ct: Let the LORD be the judge between us. Let the LORD take up my cause against you — but I will never raise my hand against you myself.

verses.kjv: As saith the proverb of the ancients, Wickedness proceedeth from the wicked: but mine hand shall not be upon thee.
verses.web: As the proverb of the ancients says, ‘Out of the wicked comes wickedness;’ but my hand will not be on you.
verses.ct: There's an old proverb that says, 'Wickedness comes from wicked people.' But my hand will not touch you.

verses.kjv: After whom is the king of Israel come out? after whom dost thou pursue? after a dead dog, after a flea.
verses.web: Against whom has the king of Israel come out? Whom do you pursue? A dead dog? A flea?
verses.ct: Think about who the king of Israel is chasing! Who are you pursuing? A dead dog? A single flea?

verses.kjv: The LORD therefore be judge, and judge between me and thee, and see, and plead my cause, and deliver me out of thine hand.
verses.web: May LORD therefore be judge, and give sentence between me and you, and see, and plead my cause, and deliver me out of your hand.”
verses.ct: Let the LORD be the judge and decide between us. Let him see the truth, argue my case, and rescue me from your hand."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when David had made an end of speaking these words unto Saul, that Saul said, Is this thy voice, my son David? And Saul lifted up his voice, and wept.
verses.web: It came to pass, when David had finished speaking these words to Saul, that Saul said, “Is that your voice, my son David?” Saul lifted up his voice, and wept.
verses.ct: When David finished speaking, Saul said, "Is that really your voice, my son David?" Then Saul broke down and wept.

verses.kjv: And he said to David, Thou art more righteous than I: for thou hast rewarded me good, whereas I have rewarded thee evil.
verses.web: He said to David, “You are more righteous than I; for you have done good to me, whereas I have done evil to you.
verses.ct: He said to David, "You are a better man than I am. You've repaid me with kindness, while I've repaid you with cruelty.

verses.kjv: And thou hast shewed this day how that thou hast dealt well with me: forasmuch as when the LORD had delivered me into thine hand, thou killedst me not.
verses.web: You have declared today how you have dealt well with me, because when LORD had delivered me up into your hand, you didn’t kill me.
verses.ct: Today you've shown just how good you are to me. The LORD handed me over to you, and you didn't kill me.

verses.kjv: For if a man find his enemy, will he let him go well away? wherefore the LORD reward thee good for that thou hast done unto me this day.
verses.web: For if a man finds his enemy, will he let him go away unharmed? Therefore may LORD reward you good for that which you have done to me today.
verses.ct: What man finds his enemy and just lets him walk away unharmed? May the LORD reward you richly for what you've done for me today.

verses.kjv: And now, behold, I know well that thou shalt surely be king, and that the kingdom of Israel shall be established in thine hand.
verses.web: Now, behold, I know that you will surely be king, and that the kingdom of Israel will be established in your hand.
verses.ct: I know now — I'm certain of it — that you will become king, and that the kingdom of Israel will be firmly established under your rule.

verses.kjv: Swear now therefore unto me by the LORD, that thou wilt not cut off my seed after me, and that thou wilt not destroy my name out of my father’s house.
verses.web: Swear now therefore to me by LORD, that you will not cut off my offspring after me, and that you will not destroy my name out of my father’s house.”
verses.ct: So swear to me by the LORD that you won't wipe out my descendants after I'm gone, and that you won't erase my family's name."

verses.kjv: And David sware unto Saul. And Saul went home; but David and his men gat them up unto the hold.
verses.web: David swore to Saul. Saul went home, but David and his men went up to the stronghold.
verses.ct: David gave Saul his oath. Then Saul went home, but David and his men went back up to their stronghold.
